sentences.en: Christian Church and Christian Empire were two sides of the same coin.
sentences.cn: 基督教教会和基督教帝国是事物的两个方面.

sentences.en: He now controls the largest retail development empire in southern California.
sentences.cn: 他现在掌管着加州南部最大的零售发展企业。

sentences.en: Her efforts were justly rewarded with a British Empire Medal.
sentences.cn: 不列颠帝国勋章是对她的努力的公正奖赏.

sentences.en: His widow has taken over the running of his empire, including six London theatres.
sentences.cn: 他的遗孀已接手管理他创下的帝国，其中包括6家伦敦剧院。

sentences.en: She published historical novels, as well as a non-fiction study of women in the British Empire.
sentences.cn: 她出版了许多历史小说和一部有关英帝国女性的纪实性研究著作。

sentences.en: The British Empire flourished in the 19 th century.
sentences.cn: 英帝国在19世纪曾昌盛一时.

sentences.en: The dead tycoon's sons will remain in their plush offices overseeing the death throes of the family empire.
sentences.cn: 这位已故大亨的儿子们将坐在豪华的办公室里，目睹这个家族帝国崩溃前的痛苦挣扎。

sentences.en: The empire had for years been falling into decadence.
sentences.cn: 这个帝国走向腐朽堕落已经经年。

sentences.en: The Empire State Building is a familiar landmark on the New York skyline.
sentences.cn: 帝国大厦是人们熟悉的纽约高楼大厦中的地标。

sentences.en: The subject peoples of her empire were anxious for their own independence.
sentences.cn: 她的帝国中被迫向她臣服的民族迫切渴望自身的独立。

sentences.en: The Thirty Year's War nearly caused the breakup of the empire.
sentences.cn: 30年的战争几乎导致帝国的解体.

sentences.en: This defeat led to the disintegration of the empire.
sentences.cn: 这次战败导致了帝国的瓦解.

sentences.en: When Constantine died, his three sons shared the empire.
sentences.cn: 君士坦丁去世后, 他的三个儿子共同分享帝国.

sentences.en: When did the empire begin to wane?
sentences.cn: 那个帝国何时开始衰落的?

sentences.en: You have built up a huge property empire by buying from wretched people who had to sell or starve.
sentences.cn: 你靠从那些不卖房就得挨饿的可怜人手里买下房子后建立起了庞大的房产帝国。

phrases.tran_cn: 拜占庭帝国（即东罗马帝国，395～1453，在欧洲东南部和亚洲西南部，由罗马帝国分裂而成）
天朝大国（中国，等于Chinese Empire）
中华帝国（指1911年以前历代中国王朝）
n. 帝国州（美国纽约州的别称）
帝国大厦（位于美国纽约州）
罗马帝国（指公元前27年到公元476年的罗马奴隶制国家）

trans.tran_en: a group of countries that are all controlled by one ruler or government
